intro: Echites francisceus var. pallidiflorus, commonly known as the pale-flowered echites, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
